column4: Hello, whenever I try to boot into ubuntu to do an install it goes to an error screen that looks kinda like this [ INCREASING NUMBER VALUE] sb_read cannot read X, block Y, size Z
[ INCREASING NUMBER] Buffer I/O ... , localical block number here

Hello, whenever I try to boot into ubuntu to do an install it goes to an error screen that looks kinda like this [ INCREASING NUMBER VALUE] sb_read cannot read X, block Y, size Z and [ INCREASING NUMBER] Buffer I/O ... , localical block number here  I cant figure it out...any ideas?
that usually indicates your hard drive is borked
Then how is Gentoo and Vista installed :o
Could it be due to the fact that I have no primary partitions open?
shouldnt, is it doing it before the partitioner stage of the install?
Nope...Just a "Try Ubuntu"
so, yes, before the partitioner, hmmm
It loads the kernel sits there for a few minutes then goes to the error screen
Directly after "Install" or "Try w/o changes to your computer"
This laptop is relatively new, perhaphs my HD isnt supported?
Ie the CD drive needed to be loaded as a pci and a few other things had to be worked around
an error like this? Buffer I/O error on device sr0, logical block 0
Yes exactly like that.
Only its logical block <Insert number 3000-4200>
heres a possibility http://www.adamstovicek.com/2008/05/hardy-heron-and-the-dvdrom-con.html
Okay Ill check it out
Im not sure thats the error...I get aq slightly different error
I'd bet its either bad drive or cable
Its a SQAUSHFS:
